result:
All 9 fixes have been created. Let me provide a summary of the fixes.

## Summary: Fixes Created for 9 ColBench Tasks

All 9 tasks had confirmed **Intrinsic Formation Errors (IFEs)** with the common pattern: **hidden information contains arbitrary magic constants/formulas that the simulated user failed to communicate or actively contradicted**.

| Task | IFE Type | Fix Summary |
|------|----------|-------------|
| **786** | Arbitrary string prefixes instead of real translation | Clarified this is a labeling function with specific prefix format |
| **797** | Hidden thresholds (proofing_time>2, temp>425) + magic return values | Specified exact piecewise logic and return values |
| **798** | Hidden formula with constant 100, threshold 0.5; user approved contradictory behavior | Specified exact formula, threshold, and boolean return type |
| **805** | Hidden formula; user endorsed constant (20,20) contradicting input-dependent formula | Specified exact shadow calculation formulas |
| **819** | Hidden baseline 0.89, special year 2012; user denied knowing these values | Specified exact formula and special-case year |
| **851** | Hidden piecewise logic with thresholds 6,0 and multipliers 0.8,0.5; user chose incompatible model | Specified exact piecewise threshold logic |
| **900** | Return type mismatch: hidden returns single list, user requested tuple/dict | Clarified expected return format (single list) |
| **913** | Arbitrary weights (0.3/0.2/0.2/0.1/0.2) not specified in task | Specified exact weighted formula |
| **958** | Arbitrary threshold (60F), exact clothing strings, non-obvious priority order | Specified exact piecewise logic with thresholds and strings |

**Common Pattern**: The ColBench simulated user is constrained to "only answer from hidden information" and "say I don't know otherwise." However, when the hidden information is code with magic constants, the simulated user often cannot translate code-level details into natural language answers, leading to "I don't know" responses that make the task unsolvable.
